bibl.title: Articles of a treaty between the United States [and] the Cherokee [Nation], Dec. 2, 1807, Chickama[u]ga
bibl.note: This document is a copy of a treaty made between the Cherokee headmen and the U.S. government through their commissioner, Return J. Meigs, at Chickamauga, December 2, 1807. The first article of the treaty allows for the sale of six square miles north of Chickamauga Creek by the Cherokees to the U.S. for the purpose of mining iron. The second article states that the U.S. shall agree to pay the sum of five thousand dollars and one thousand bushels of corn upon ratification of the treaty. The treaty further states that if the U.S. should fail to find iron ore within the ceded land, they shall be able to get the ore in another place.

div1.p: Articles of a treaty between the united states of america, by then Commisioner Return J Meigs who were apointed to hold a conference with the Cherokee for the purpose of purchasing a tract of land, a Site for Iron Works at the mouth of Chickamaga Creek on the South side of Tennessee

Whereas it has been represented to the Chiefs & Warriours of said nation, that Such a Site would be diserable both for the united states & the cherokee nation, to them mutual advantages the chiefs & warriours have agreed to, and sold to the unitedStates, six miles Square at the mouth of chickamaga Creek, on the South side of tennessee river& to be laid off in a Square tract So as to include the creek to the best advantage for said Site

div2.head: 2nd
div2.p:
and it is further agreed that the united States shall pay to the cherokee Indians the sum of five thousand dollars, so soon as the said treaty shall be ratified, and one thousand bushels of corn
Provided nevertheless that the Iron ore should fail Within Said limits ceeded - the united States them and in that case, Shall have full liberty to let ore off there land in the most Suitable place

In testimony whereof the undersigned commisioner & the chiefs and warriours of the Cherokee nation have set there hands & seals Done at Highwassee this 2nd day of December in the year of our lord one thousand Eight hundred and Sevin
